name: Version 2.6.0-M2
body:
- Add specification and implementation details to manifest
- Remove `animal-sniffer-annotations` as required runtime dependency for `tinylog-impl` (see [#326](https://github.com/tinylog-org/tinylog/commit/44e1b9f56f75a7a0b72116176cd19905592eec41))

name: Version 2.6.0-M1
body:
- Improved support for SLF4J 2
  - Output correct class names when using the new fluent API (#291)
  - Provide the new deque methods for MDC
- Rewritten macros for Scala API
   - Improve support for Scala 2.12.17 and 2.13.9
   - Different bundle names (`org.tinylog.api.scala_2.12` and `org.tinylog.api.scala_2.13`) for providing both bundles via P2 repository
   - Logging API for Scala requires Java 8+ now (logging API for Java and Kotlin is still compatible with Java 6 and 7)

name: Version 2.5.0
body:
The final release version 2.5.0 contains the same set of features as tinylog 2.5.0-M2.1 as no further bugs were found.

Special thanks to [f4lco](https://github.com/f4lco) for his generous donation to tinylog!

name: Version 2.5.0-M2.1
body:
- Fix VerifyError while loading configuration on legacy Android versions (discovered on Android 4.4, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72727738/tinylog-android-verifyerror-exception)
- Update Kotlin to version 1.4.21 due to [CVE-2020-29582](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-29582)

name: Version 2.5.0-M2
body:
- Keep buffer of `JdbcWriter` after connection loss (#91)
- `DynamicPolicy` continues existing files  (#251, thanks to @simon04)
- Require module `java.naming` by `org.tinylog.api` for `JndiValueResolver` (#248)
- Line-delimited JSON support for `JsonWriter` (#229)

name: Version 2.5.0-M1.1
body: Fix resolving environment variables, JNDI values, and system properties in configuration properties files

name: Version 2.5.0-M1
body:
- Support for `System.Logger` as third-party logging API (#221 and #224, thanks to @Trigtrig)
- Close JSON array after every `flush()` of JSON writer (#205)
- New dynamic label and dynamic policy for programmatic interaction (#230, thanks to @simon04)
- Support resolving JNDI values in configuration (#235)
- Support Scala 2.13 by tinylog's Scala logging API (#237)
- Allow extending `TinylogLoggingProvider` for using another `ContextProvider` (#239)
- Support defining a schema for JDBC writer (#243 and #244, thanks to @Sollder1)

name: Version 2.4.1
body: Compatibility fix for SLF4J 2.0

name: Version 2.4.0
body: The final release version 2.4.0 contains the same set of features as the first and second milestone. Additionally, it adds support for the latest alpha 5 of SLF4J 2.0 (see #222).

name: Version 2.4.0-M2
body:
- Support for defining size or maximum size for format pattern placeholders (#219, thanks to @kropp)
- Trim white space around configuration values automatically
- Support custom time zones by date policies (#217)
- Use class loader from class if context loader provides no service files (#216)
- Support multiple tags by a single tagged logger (#201, thanks to @kahgoh)
- All fixed from tinylog 2.3.1 and 2.3.2

name: Version 2.3.2
body:
- Fix using user defined configuration loaders instead of tinylog's default properties file loader (#210)
- Fix using GZIP compression in a Java Platform Module System project (see #211)

name: Version 2.3.1
body: - Fix writing log entries into log files when using charsets that have BOMs as charset headers like UTF-16 and UTF-32 (#207)

name: Version 2.4.0-M1
body:
- Support for SLF4J 2.0 (#119, thanks to @f4lco)
- New JSON writer (#194, thanks to @proohit)

name: Version 2.3.0
body: The final release version 2.3.0 contains the same set of features as the second milestone. However, there are a few performance optimizations.

name: Version 2.3.0-M2
body:
* Fix restarting the count when using a count placeholder to together with other placeholders in a file name (#141)
* Fix throwing exceptions for SLF4J LocationAwareLoggers with an invalid logger class name (#191)
* Add monthly policy for rolling file writer (#154)
* Create benchmarks for different location information (#193)
* Report if GZIP encoder cannot create compressed file
* Improve performance of replacing new lines in message tokens

name: Version 2.3.0-M1
body:
- Support custom configuration loaders and extending tinylog's native logging provider (#168)
- Support configuring different severity levels for different tags of a single writer (#174)
- Make severity level threshold configurable for using error stream by console writer (#180)
- Support multiple placeholders in choice format patterns (#189)

name: Version 2.2.1
body: Fix issuing tagged log entries on Kotlin when the visible severity level is higher than trace (#188, thanks to @psimicek)

name: Version 2.2.0
body: Since no bugs were found for the first release candidate within a month, it can be released unchanged as final version 2.2.0.

name: Version 2.2.0-RC1
body: All new features and improvements for tinylog 2.2 are complete and ready for use.

name: Version 2.2.0-M4
body:
- Several fixes for gzip compressing of backed up log files (#139)
- Fix for continuing already existing log files for rolling file writer (#171)

name: Version 2.2.0-M3
body:
**New:**
- Uptime placeholder for outputting the application uptime in format patterns (#129)
- Converting API for rolling file writer and gzip compression for backup files (#139)
- Allow access to writers and logging providers (#158, thanks to @Git5000) 
- Multiple tags can be assigned to the same writer (#164, thanks to @Git5000) 
- Multiple logging providers can be configured by name (#166, thanks to @Git5000) 

**Fixes:**
- Logger prefix was missing when logging internal tinylog exceptions
- Potential null pointer exceptions for using unconfigured tokens in custom writers (#159, thanks to @Git5000)
- Empty log files were created for writers with logging level `off` (#162)

name: Version 2.2.0-M2
body:
* Throw an exception when trying to change a frozen configuration (#143)
* Add `{level-code}` token for output the severity level as integer (#111)
* Fix deleting backup files when logging via `RollingFileWriter` to a relative path without any sub folder (#155)

name: Version 2.2.0-M1
body:
* `RollingFileWriter` can optionally link the latest log file to a static shortcut file (#149)
* All artifacts are real modules now (see #151)

name: Version 2.1.2
body: Simplify the usage of tinylog in Eclipse plugins and RCP applications by declaring `tinylog-impl`, `tinylog-jboss`, and `tinylog-jul` as a fragments for `tinylog-api`

name: Version 2.1.1
body: Handle `UnsatisfiedLinkError` for full support of GraalVM (#145)

name: Version 2.1.0
body: Since no bugs were found for the third release candidate within three weeks, it can be released unchanged as final version 2.1.0.

name: Version 2.1.0-RC3
body: Fix class file version (previous release candidate was incompatible with Java 6-8)

name: Version 2.1.0-RC2
body:
* Fix `NullPointerExceptions` for threads without context class loader (#131)
* Fix outputting curly brackets via third-party logging API (#132)
* Support escaping of curly brackets by using ticks (#132)

name: Version 2.1.0-RC1
body:
**New:**
- Exceptions and stack traces can be filtered and transformed for clearer output (#79)
- Load configuration from `tinylog-dev.properties` or `tinylog-test.properties` if available (#75)
- Configurable default values for environment variables and system properties (#112)
- Artifact for tinylog's logging API for Scala contains the Scala version now

name: Version 2.0.1
body:
* Include workaround for ProGuard to avoid incorrect removal of tinylog classes (#126)
* Add default constructors to improve support for GraalVM (#127)

name: Version 2.0.0
body: Since no bugs were found for the second release candidate within one month, it can be released unchanged as final version 2.0.0.

name: Version 2.0.0-RC2
body:
**Changes:**
* Include an automatic module name in the manifest (#110)
* Reuse the module names as bundle names for consistency
* Store numeric timestamp in database by timestamp token

name: Version 2.0.0-RC1
body:
**New:**
* Implementation for JBoss Logging based web and application servers
* Implementation for `java.util.logging` based web and application servers
* Timestamp token for outputting time in milliseconds or seconds (thanks to @ryanthon)

name: Version 2.0.0-M4.3
body:
**Changes**
* Fix NullPointerException when passing `null` as marker via SLF4J API

name: Version 2.0.0-M4.2
body:
**Changes**
* Renamed tag property of logcat writer into `tagname` to avoid conflicts between tinylog tags and logcat tags (#99)

name: Version 2.0.0-M4.1
body:
**Fixes**
* Logging API for Scala doesn't require to import `org.tinylog.Supplier` anymore

name: Version 2.0.0-M4
body:
**New:**
* Logging API for Kotlin (#94)
* Logging API for Scala

**Fixes:**
* Logging framework implementation not found in Java Web Start applications (#96)
* Style options for nested format patterns not evaluated (#97)
* Rolling file writer finds not matching log files (#98)

name: Version 2.0.0-M3
body:
**New:**
* Binding for Apache Commons Logging (JCL)
* Compatible logging API with Apache Log4j 1.2
* Bridge for JBoss Logging 3

**Fixes:**
* ConcurrentModificationException when system properties change while loading the configuration (#93)

name: Version 1.3.6
body:
**Fixes:**
* ConcurrentModificationException when system properties change while loading the configuration (#93)

name: Version 2.0.0-M2.1
body:
**Fixes:**
* Parsing parameters for multiple policies for rolling file writer (#84)
* Animal sniffer annotations are not a required Maven dependency anymore

name: Version 2.0.0-M2
body:
**New:**
* Binding for SLF4J 1.6 and 1.7
* Compatible logging API with tinylog 1.3
* Bridge for JUL (java.util.logging)

name: Version 2.0.0-M1
body:
**Changes:**
* Separation of API and implementation (tinylog-api.jar and tinylog-impl.jar)
* Compiled with debug information as it is nowadays common
* Root package is `org.tinylog` instead of `org.pmw.tinylog`
* [Logger](tinylog-api/src/main/java/org/tinylog/Logger.java) class contains only methods relevant for logging
* Properties are set without `tinylog.` prefix in `tinylog.properties` (for example: just `level` instead of `tinylog.level`)
* Logcat writer is the default writer on Android

**New features:**
* Log entries can be optionally [tagged](tinylog-api/src/main/java/org/tinylog/Logger.java#L53)
  * Tags can be output via `{tag}` placeholder
  * A writer can be bound to a tag via the property `writer.tag`
* Multiple logging implementations can be combined (log entries can be redirected to the logging system of the application server and additionally be written to a separate log file by tinylog itself)
* Charset can be defined for file based writer (for example: `writer.charset = UTF-8`)

**Dropped features:**
* Fluent-API (The recommended way to configure tinylog are properties files. Nevertheless the configuration can be changed or set programmatically via the [Configuration](tinylog-api/src/main/java/org/tinylog/configuration/Configuration.java) class.)
* Mutable configurations (For performance reasons, the configuration becomes immutable, when the first logging method is called.)

name: Version 1.3.5
body:
**Changes:**
* Support JVMs that don't support the system properties `java.runtime.name` or `os.name`

name: Version 1.3.4
body:
**Changes:**
* Fix resolving of environment variables in file names for `FileWriter`

name: Version 1.3.3
body:
**Changes:**
* Fix deleting backup log files when initializing the rolling file writer

name: Version 1.3.2
body:
**Changes:**
* Fix declaration of OSGi bundles

name: Version 1.3.1
body:
**Changes:**
* Fix detecting Java 9.0.1 as Java 9

name: Version 1.3
body: Identical to the previous release candidate RC2

name: Version 1.3 RC 2
body:
**Changes:**
- Support lambdas for lazy generation of messages and arguments
- Reuse SQL-Statements in JDBC writer
- Output print stream is configurable for console writer

name: Version 1.3 RC 1
body:
**Changes:**
- Use new standard API for receiving process ID and stack trace elements on Java 9
- Support microseconds and nanoseconds for timestamps on Java 9
- Drop support for Java 5

name: Version 1.2
body: Identical to the previous release candidate RC3

name: Version 1.2 RC 3
body:
**Changes:**
- Fix NullPointerException when loading tinylog with BootstrapClassLoader (Thanks to cristianspinetta)

name: Version 1.2 RC 2
body:
**Changes:**
- Fix rolling log files at startup

name: Version 1.2 RC 1
body:
**Changes:**
- Support loading configurations remote from URLs
- Support choice format in log messages
- Support formatting numbers in log messages

name: Version 1.2 Beta 1
body:
**Changes:**
- Provide tinylog compatible logging API for application servers
- Resolve placeholders in paths
- Support loading configurations from any input stream

name: Version 1.2 Alpha 2
body:
**Changes:**
- Add support JavaEE DataSources
- Add support for Android
- Add logcat writer for Android

name: Version 1.2 Alpha 1
body:
**Changes:**
- Add auto reconnecting option for JDBC writer
- Add support of exceptions that are passed as last parameter in SLF4J binding
- Fix NullPointerException if a non-existent thread should be observed
